result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory S. Nerison was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full.  Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.
Sentence to start on or before April 18, 2016 at 6:00 pm.  EMP allowed according to jail rules.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cory S. Nerison

defendant.name: Nerison, Cory S.
defendant.address: N6969 County Road A, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Defendant plead no contest to the charge contained in the information.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he plead to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of felon in possession of firearm contrary to 941.29(2)(a).  Joint recommendation for 25 fine, plus costs.  20 days jail.  $559.50 total.  Sentence to start on or before April 18, 2016 at 6 pm.  EMP allowed, according to jail rules.
Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance served on A.J. to appear at 4/14 JT
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 15, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared with Attorney Matousek.  Still going to trial.  Motions will be heard the morning of trial.  Attorney Matousek still needs some facebook discovery.  DA's office to follow up with JASO.  Get discovery to Attorney Matousek by 3/25.

ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Matousek.  Deputy A.J. called by State, sworn.  Attorney moved to sequester the witnesses.  Granted.  State questioned witness.  Exhibit 1 marked.  Screen shot of facebook sale posting.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects identification.  State moves for admission of exhibit 1.  No objection by defense for the purposes of this hearing.  Attorney Matousek questioned witness.  State called Detective S.B., sworn.  Questioned by State.  Venue established.  Witness identified the defendant.  Record reflects identification.  Attorney Matousek questioned witness.  State asks court to take judicial notice of 06CF151.  Court takes judicial notice of said case.  Attorney Matousek argued against bind over.  Court found probable cause.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant appeared with counsel John Matousek.  ADA Melissa Inlow appears for the State.  Defense waived reading of the complaint; waived time limits for preliminary hearing; requests pretrial.  Court reviewed right to preliminary hearing with defendant and accepts waiver of time limits.  Court set pretrial and status dates.  Bond is continued.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals and/or businesses:  George C.  Not to possess any firearms.

Defendant appeared by video from Jackson County Jail.  DA Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Defendant admits to receipt of complaint.  Court reviews charge/penalties.  He has already contacted the SPDO.  Adjourned initial appearance set for 5-4-15 at 9:30.
